title: Yali-Angguruk (1992) New Testament (Print) SABDA
description:
Yali (Yaly, Jal√®, Jaly) is a Papuan language of Indonesian New Guinea. The Yali people live east of the Baliem Valley, in the Western Highlands.

Dialectical differentiation is great enough that Ethnologue assigns separate codes to three varieties: (1) Pass Valley, also known as Abendago, North Ngalik, and Western Yali; subdialects are Pass Valley, Landikma, Apahapsili. (2) Ninia, also known as North Ngalik and Southern Yali (Yali Selatan). (3) Angguruk, also known as Northern Yali.

language.name: Angguruk Yali
language.area: Central highlands area northwest of Nalca, east of Grand Valley Dani.
